settings.title: Erectile Dysfunction Treatment
settings.subtitle: Erectile Dysfunction ('ED') is the inability to sustain or get an erection. ED can be effectively treated with Sildenafil, popularly called Viagra. Other short-term medications include Avanafil, Vardenafil and Tadalafil.

settings.title: Is erectile dysfunction permanent?
settings.text: ED is a common disorder and can be treated successfully with medications when reversible. Most often, Sildenafil and other pills will work immediately and improve the condition unless ED is caused due to a medical condition.

settings.title: What causes ED?
settings.text: ED can be caused by physical or psychological factors. Stress, anxiety, fatigue, and overconsumption of alcohol are common causes of ED. Hormonal imbalances and underlying diseases can also cause ED.

settings.title: Of Men Experience Erectile Dysfunction.
settings.text: It is regarded as a common disorder, especially for those above the age of 40.

settings.title: Effective: Sildenafil and Tadalafil
settings.text: The two most commonly prescribed ED medications for quick improvement are Sildenafil and Tadalafil.

settings.title: Erectile Dysfunction Treatment Online
settings.text:
“Erectile dysfunction (ED), also known as impotence, is the inability to achieve or maintain an erection sufficient for satisfactory sexual intercourse. It can be frustrating and embarrassing, but it is a very common condition, affecting up to one in five men.

However, in most cases it is due to a physical problem or psychological issues!”
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.text: You will then receive your order the next working day using our express next-day courier service, dispensed from one of our verified GhPC partner pharmacies in the UK.

settings.title: How does ED treatment work?
settings.text: ED pills target the enzyme called phosphodiesterase 5 which helps with muscle contraction. By inhibiting the enzyme, ED pills relax the blood vessels of the penis, stimulating blood flow and thereby, helping with an erection.

settings.title: What are the side effects of ED pills?
settings.text:
ED Pills are safe however, they can cause minor side effects in some individuals. The side effects include:

Nausea

Nasal congestion

Allergic reaction or rashes

Stomach discomfort

Headache

settings.title: Which erectile dysfunction drug is best?
settings.text: Depending on your lifestyle and suitability, you can choose which ED drug works best for you. Each ED drug takes a different amount of time to show effect and will last for a varying time period.

settings.title: Can alcohol cause erectile dysfunction?
settings.text: Alcohol can lead to an erectile dysfunction disorder in men. This is because alcohol has a short-term impact on the circulatory system as well as hormonal balance. Also, alcohol can cause severe dehydration which increases antiogensin (a hormone that helps with the narrowing of blood vessels). Alcohol dependence can also lead to cardiovascular issues, another cause of ED.

settings.title: How much time does it take for ED pills to work?
settings.text:
Different ED Pills have different effectiveness when sexually aroused:

1. Sildenafil: One hour to start working and can last up to 4 hours

2. Tadalafil: Half hour to start working and can last up to 36 hours

settings.title: Are the ED pills available without prescription?
settings.text: Only Sildenafil or Viagra can be obtained without a prescription. However, you can take our short online consultation to find out more information.

settings.text: All our medication is packaged in plain confidential padded white or brown envelopes. This ensures that your orders are discreet, and the content of the orders will be for your eyes only.

settings.title: When will my order be delivered?
settings.text: If you have placed an order before 14:00 Monday to Friday, you will receive the order the next day.

settings.title: Can I return my order?
settings.text: For non-medicinal products, you are eligible to return the product within 14 days of receipt in the same packaging you received. For medicinal products, you are eligible to cancel the order only until it has been dispatched. From that point forward, you are no longer eligible to return the order.

settings.title: Can I cancel my order?
settings.text: You have the right to cancel your order for medication up to the point when your medication is dispatched.

settings.title: Is this medication suitable for me?
settings.text: Please get in touch with a doctor if you are unsure what medication is suitable for you. You can also complete our online consultation form to check your eligibility for the product.

settings.title: Can I order this if I am under 18 years old?
settings.text: No, we do not accept orders from individuals under 18. All orders must be placed by adults only.

settings.title: What are the symptoms of erectile dysfunction?
settings.text:
Erectile dysfunction is a common problem that affects many men over the age of 40 in the UK.

It is identified when you have one or more of the following symptoms:

- Trouble getting an erection

- Difficulty maintaining an erection

- A reduced sex drive.

As the process of achieving an erection involves multiple bodily functions working harmoniously together, there could be various reasons why you are experiencing ED. Male sexual arousal involves the hormones, emotions, nerves, muscles, brain and blood vessels and can easily be affected by mental and physical conditions such as stress.

settings.title: What erectile dysfunction medications are there?
settings.text:
Medical advances for erectile dysfunction have created several types of medicines that work to effectively treat symptoms of ED. The right medication for you will depend on the underlying cause of your ED.

The most common medication for ED is a group of medicine called phosphodiesterase-5 (PDE-5) inhibitors. These medicines work to temporarily increase the blood flow to the penis when you get sexually excited by enhancing the effects of nitric oxide (a naturally-occurring chemical in the body that relaxes the muscles in the penis). This effectively brings on an erection.

PDE-5 inhibitors should be taken about 30-60 minutes before you intend to have an erection. The most common types of PDE-5 inhibitors are sildenafil (Viagra), tadalafil (Cialis), vardenafil (Levitra) and avanafil (Spedra).

There are usually multiple strengths of these drugs, with some low doses that are suitable for daily use that can allow for spontaneous erections.

settings.title: Are there any alternative treatments for erectile dysfunction?
settings.text:
Erectile dysfunction is a condition that will vary from person-to-person. Some people may be unable to take the popular oral PDE-5 inhibitor medicines, or they might prefer a different type of treatment altogether. 

The following are the alternatives for ED treatment:

- If you have ED as a result of a hormone imbalance, hormone replacement therapy (HRT) may be prescribed to restore testosterone levels.

- Vacuum pumps are a physical stimulus for encouraging blood flow to the penis for an erection.

- Injectable drugs, such as alprostadil, can be injected into the shaft of the penis and relax the muscles and blood vessels.

- Urethra suppository. Alprostadil can also be made into a pellet and inserted into the urethra (the tube through which urine is passed) with a special applicator. This is known as intraurethral therapy.

- Topical treatments. A cream or other solution that contains alprostadil can be applied to the opening of the penis (meatus) with a special applicator and improve erections.

- Penile implants. Implants are inserted into the penis that can allow you control over the duration and timing of your erections.

settings.title: What can I expect to happen when I take erectile dysfunction tablets?
settings.text: Taking ED tablets will generally require sexual stimulation for them to take effect. Once the stimulation occurs, nitric oxide will be released from the penile nerves and the medications will begin to amplify their natural erection-forming effects. Simultaneously, blood flow to the penis will increase and an erection will form.

settings.title: Are ED tablets safe in the long term?
settings.text: There may be variations in the safety of ED medications. The most popular of which, sildenafil (brand name Viagra), and tadalafil (brand name Cialis), have been found to be safe for long-term use. These findings have been the result of monitoring over months and years of continued use.

settings.title: Can I change my treatment if it doesn't work for me?
settings.text: Yes, you and your doctor should work together to find a suitable treatment. Many medications and treatments are available so that individuals can find the best product for themselves.
